result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert A. Hendrickson

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 20, 2022 at 11:00 am.

9:44 AM cases 22CF68, 22CF619 called. Prosecuting Attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Robert A. Hendrickson appeared by video, in custody from the Eau Claire County Jail.  Attorney George E. Miller in court for Robert A. Hendrickson. Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas. Court accepts the pleas.

Branch 1 for further scheduling.

9:49 AM cases 22CF68, 22CF619 called. Defendant Robert A. Hendrickson in court, in custody.  Attorney George E. Miller in court for Robert A. Hendrickson.  Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin. In both files: Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. Both files are referred to Branch 1 to schedule an ARGN (possible plea).

It is ordered that Attorney Francis Rivard is withdrawn as counsel.

Attorney has no information for the Court as to the Defendant's non-appearance. State indicates DOC warrant- requests warrant. Warrant ordered.

Conditions:

Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.
